sen.j: 能阿弥（のうあみ、応永4年（1397年） - 文明 (日本)3年（1471年））は、室町時代の画家、茶人、連歌師。
sen.e: Noami (1397 - 1471) is a painter, master of ceremonial tea, and Rengashi (poet who only writes Tsureuta (early Japanese poetry form)) who lived in the Muromachi period.

sen.j: 子に芸阿弥、孫に相阿弥がいる。
sen.e: Geiami is Noami's son, and Soami is Noami's grandson.

sen.j: 元は越前朝倉氏の家臣だったが、足利義教、足利義政に同朋衆として仕えて能阿弥と号し、幕府における書画等（唐物）の鑑定や管理を行い、また東山御物の制定を行った。
sen.e: Originally a subordinate of Echizen-Asakurashi (Asakura clan), Noami served Yoshinori ASHIKAGA and Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA as a member of Doboshu (Shogun's cultural curators or experts) and called himself Noami; and he appraised and managed things imported from China such as paintings and writings, and he also established higashiyama gyomotsu (things, such as paintings, tea utensils, flower vases, collected by Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA, shogun of the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun)).

sen.j: 特に水墨画に優れ阿弥派の開祖とされ、鶴図を描き義政に絶賛されたといわれる。
sen.e: Noami was especially excellent at Suiboku-ga (ink painting) and is considered the founder of Ami-ha group of painters; and it is said that Noami's painting of cranes was highly praised by Yoshimasa.

sen.e: The Hakui Kannon zu (painting of Kannon (Buddhist deity of mercy) in white wearing) in Myogon-in, Sennyu-ji temple was painted by Noami in 1471.

sen.j: 茶道においては、書院飾りの完成、台子飾りの方式の制定などを行い、『山上宗二記』では「同朋中の名人」と記されている。
sen.e: In Sado (tea ceremony), Noami completed the shoin kazari (decoration of shoin (one of Japan's most important residential architectural styles, established in the Momoyama period) rooms and buildings) and established the formalities for daisu kazari (decorating the utensil stand), among other achievements, and is described as an "expert of the companions" in YAMANOUE no Soji ki (book of secrets written by YAMANOUE no Soji, best pupil of SEN no Rikyu, a great tea master).

sen.j: そのほか連歌、華道にも優れ、連歌では七賢の一人に挙げられ、北野天満宮の連歌奉行も務めた。
sen.e: Furthermore, Noami also excelled at Tsureuta and Kado (flower arrangement); and he was named one of the seven wise men in Tsureuta and served Renga bugyo (magistrate of Renga (another term for Tsureuta) party) of Kitano Tenman-gu temple.
